title: BBC Local Live: Leicestershire on Thursday 2 February 2017 - BBC News
summary: council gives £ 50k to help save unit at glenfield hopital .
cole and youngs named in the england six nations side .
antisocial behaviour issue in lutterworth park .
fat rabbit gets charity help to diet .
one year since vardy scored 'that goal ' .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 friday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from leicestershire local live - updates will start again on friday at 08:00 .

documents.title: weather : heavy rain friday afternoon
text: there will be patchy cloud and some clear spells tonight .
it 'll feel a bit cooler as temperatures drop slightly with clearer skies .
mostly dry although the odd spot of rain possible - lows of 6c ( 43f ) .
some bright intervals to start on friday but turning increasingly cloudy with some outbreaks of heavy rain through the afternoon .
a maximum temperature of 9c ( 48f ) .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: snooker : win for selby in berlin
text: leicester 's mark selby has beaten thepchaiya un-nooh 5-0 in the opening round of the german masters .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: traders celebrate national award
text: yesterday i told you loughborough market had won `` best large outdoor market '' at the british market of the year awards 2017 .
well here they are today with their award
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: authorities to collaborate over behaviour issues
text: pcc willy bach described the behaviour in lutterworth as a `` blight '' on the community .
comparing the problem to a similar one in countesthorpe last year he seemed confident that between the police and other partners they can come up with `` sustainable solutions '' .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mp on solving anti-social behaviour
text: mp alberto costa said he considered anti-social behaviour a `` vitally important issue '' .

he said : `` anti-social behaviour can be the cause of considerable distress and upset for residents hence why i 'm very pleased to have the relevant stakeholders together in one place so we can find a workable solution to the issues affecting residents in lutterworth . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: town meeting over nuisance behaviour
text: the coventry road recreation ground in lutterworth seems to have become a problem area for antisocial behaviour
there was a meeting this afternoon in the town to discuss the issue .
among those there was leicestershire police and crime commissioner lord willy bach and mp alberto costa .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hospital sets new blood record
text: our royal infirmary set a fantastic record after the 100th unit of umbilical cord blood was collected by blood cancer charity anthony nolan !
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your comments : quirky and peculiar customs
text: thanks to vic foster for explaining the hare pie scramble to me after seeing this
`` the hare pie is what is served up at the beginning of hallaton bottle kicking , held every easter monday i think since about the beginning of time .
this is the annual contest between the people of hallaton and medbourne as they attempt to get a bottle ( called a cheese ) into their opponent 's home area .
the first to get two cheeses/bottles is the winner . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: listen : on this day in 2016
text: the greatest leicester city goal ?
plus ian stringer 's crazy commentary
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: 'fewer complaints about hospital parking '
text: so is it now easier to park at the hospital since their new car park opened ?
apparently it 's made a `` huge difference ''
darryn kerr is director of facilities at leicester 's hospitals and said : `` we 've seen queues dramatically reduce - we have seen complaints about parking dramatically reduce too . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new laws to protect puppies
text: meet balloo from whitwick - he 's 10 weeks old and completely adorable
new laws will help protect thousands of puppies making it completely illegal to sell them younger than eight weeks .
author: Helen Astle
BBC East Midlands Today reporter

documents.title: mp praises ken clarke on 'alice in wonderland ' speech
text: loughborough mp nicky morgan has said that never in my adult life have i felt so concerned about the stability and state of the world in which we live '' following mps ' vote to trigger britain 's exit from the european union .
author: Loughborough Echo

documents.title: your photos : puddles in long whatton
text: looking very wet in north leicestershire
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: anniversary of new car park
text: blimey has it been a year already ?
happy 1st birthday to our multi-storey car park at the royal infirmary !
i bet poor staff , working hard still has to pay for parking ?
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : diet time for king-sized rabbit
text: not to worry though - zeus has `` hopped '' into action and started a diet to help shed those pounds
he 's joined the charity 's version of the biggest loser and will spend the next six months on a healthy eating and exercise program along with companion nala .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : quirky and peculiar customs
text: a nice video about some slightly odd customs performed across the uk in the 1970s - including one in leicestershire
hare pie scramble can someone please explain ?
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fat rabbit worries animal charity
text: this is zeus the rabbit from leicester - he 's so big he 's been mistaken for a dog
the pdsa says he weighs 1st 3lbs ( 8kg ) - more than double the size he should be .
time to cut back on the carrots ?
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lazy pets are 'obesity time-bomb '
text: have you got a chubby cat or a podgy pooch ?
according to the animal charity pdsa our pets are living a `` couch-potato lifestyle '' , making lots of them obese .
they say this is down to a diet of treats and not enough exercise - apparently 20 % of dogs in the east midlands do n't get a daily walk .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: afternoon weather update
text: plenty of cloud around along with a few light showers on a breezy afternoon .
potential for a few limited brighter spells but mainly overcast .
highs of 11c ( 52f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: air ambulance called to a46 crash
text: i 've just been looking at the details of that crash on the a46 in ratcliffe on the wreake .
it happened just after 18:30 .
two men had minor injuries and were released from their vehicles by the fire service .
an ambulance and the air ambulance were also called to the scene .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: curious question after ratcliffe on the wreake crash
text: bumper ?
crews attended an rtc last night on the a46 .
interesting of a part of the car found in the tree name the part ?
roofbars
its a good guess but not correct .
keep guessing
looks to me like a cross member that fits behind the plastic bumper
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : master ukulele player
text: i 've been to see mark fereby showing off his musical skills on world ukulele day
mark also teaches people to play the instrument - he said some people use it as a gateway into playing guitar or violin .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: celebration of the ukulele
text: random fact for you now - today is world ukulele day
no , i did n't know it was a thing either but bbc radio leicester did and they 're got a local ukulele player in .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'save glenfield ' protest
text: as we 've been talking about glenfield hospital 's children 's heart services this morning it might be a good time to remind you there 's going to be another protest march soon
like last time - the march will leave victoria park at 11:00 and go down to jubilee square .
it will be on saturday 11 february .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: youngs and cole make england 's starting 15
text: leicester tigers ben youngs and dan cole will start for england in their six nations match against france on saturday .
breaking | your england team to play france in the rbs 6 nations this saturday preview # carrythemhome
# amazing ☞ # rbs6nations # blackcab ☛ .

pretty much lancasters side

get rid of farrell and use two proper centres .
delete
delete ?
`` get rid of farrell '' - most stupid comment of the year .
congrats

apart from kicking what does he offer
you 're surpasing your own stupidty .

huge congrats to all our @ twitterid representing @ twitterid for # lecrunch we will be cheering you on from # lesofa # rosearmy

BBC Local Live

documents.title: amartey 's ghana in semi-final
text: leicester city 's daniel amartey could help ghana to a place in the africa cup of nations final tonight .
the ghanaians face cameroon in the semi-final at 19:00 this evening .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: teens charges with park robbery
text: two teenagers have been charged with robbery after a person had their wallet stolen at knife point in victoria park .
the two 17-year-olds are due to appear before leicester youth court tomorrow .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: east midlands weather forecast
text: east midlands weather forecast
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: bridgen votes with constituency majority
text: mr bridgen spoke about his fellow conservative ken clarke who was the only tory to vote against bill .
he said : `` ken stuck with his principles and that 's what he should always do and that 's the way his constituency voted .
`` the rest of the east midlands , leicestershire , voted to leave the european union .
north-west leicestershire voted 61 % to 31 % to leave the european union . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest leicestershire headlines
text: latest leicestershire headlines
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mp bridgen 's comments on brexit vote
text: last night mps started the brexit process by overwhelmingly approving article 50
the leicestershire mp andrew bridgen has been a firm supporter for leaving the eu .
speaking on bbc radio leicester this morning , he said : `` the people of the uk voted to leave the european union - we 're there to implement the will of the people .
`` i think it 's going to prove a watershed for politics and politicians and we can see a resurgence in our popularity across the country . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : rainy start to the day
text: a dull , drizzly and showery start to the day - however this afternoon should be a little drier .
becoming breezy later with highs of 11c ( 52f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: leicester mercury headline
text: today 's front page - read the headline story here .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: hospital 'not meeting standards '
text: glenfield is one of three hospitals that was told by nhs england last year it would have to stop performing surgery on children with heart problems .
health bosses said the trusts were not meeting required standards and services would be transferred elsewhere .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: council against 'flawed and foolish ' nhs england plan
text: i fully support the campaign to save this unit , which is so valued by families across leicestershire and the wider region .
i said from the outset that this was a flawed decision .
the care quality commission has just rated this service as outstanding for effectiveness , making nhs england 's proposal to close it look not only flawed but foolish .
that 's why we are committing £ 50,000 to support the uhl board , in the event it is forced to challenge the decision in the courts . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: council financial back hospital campaign
text: leicestershire county council has given £ 50,000 to the fighting fund campaigning to keep the children 's heart unit at glenfield hospital open .
the authority has said the money came from an `` underspend '' .
it 'll be used to help fund a potential legal challenge against plans to move cardiac services .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: snooker : leicester players in action
text: mark selby and ben wollaston get their campaigns underway at the german masters later .
leicester 's tom ford played last night and won 5-2 against peter ebdon .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: madeleine 's parents 'disappointed ' by libel ruling
text: the parents of madeleine mccann say they are disappointed after portugal 's highest court threw out their libel case against an ex-detective .
madeleine , from rothley , leicestershire , went missing days before her fourth birthday , while on a family holiday in the algarve in 2007 .
in 2015 , goncalo amaral was ordered to pay 500,000 euros ( £ 425,000 ) to kate and gerry mccann , after he implicated them in their daughter 's disappearance .
the decision was overturned following an appeal last year .
the mccanns took the case to portugal 's supreme court , but it has been dismissed .
author: Neil Heath
BBC News Online

documents.title: travel : congestion on a6 kibworth
text: traffic is building on the # a6 in # kibworth where the emergency water works continue around main street .
yes it does look like these are still there .
heavy traffic either side
lane closed and slow traffic westbound towards junction 1 .
that wo n't change till at least tomorrow
you 're welcome
the latest we have is they should be completed later today .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : 'emergency ' closes lane on a50
text: there 's slow traffic and one lane closed on the a50 eastbound in lockington because of medical emergency .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live news coverage
text: hello leicestershire - i hope you 're well this thursday morning .
i 'll be writing the updates on your local live page today with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
if you 'd like to get involved with the live stream you can send an email or use facebook or twitter .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live
